com.vectorprint.configuration.binding.parameters.json

Class JSONSupport

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vectorprint.configuration.binding.parameters.AbstractParameterizableBinding<Object>
      • com.vectorprint.configuration.binding.parameters.json.JSONSupport
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ParameterizableParser<Object>, ParameterizableSerializer

    public class JSONSupport
extends AbstractParameterizableBinding<Object>
    Parser / serializer to support JSON syntax. This parser is less efficient than ParameterizableParserImpl which instantiates and initializes a Parameterizable object during parsing. Robert Fischer's JSON parser is used under the hood. This parser yields a generic Java datamodel (Map, List, String, BigDecimal, etc.) which is translated into a Parameterizable object.
    Author:
    Eduard Drenth at VectorPrint.nl

      TYPE      		 parseAsParameterValue(String valueToParse, Parameter<TYPE> parameter)
      Useful when looking for (default) values for a parameter.
      Parameterizable parseParameterizable()
      syntax looks like this: {'P':[{'a':[1,2]},{'b':3}]}, P is the Parameterizable, a and b are parameters first and only entry in the Map is the name of the Parameterizable class and its parameters in a List each entry in the parameter List contains the parameter key and its value(s) in a Map parameter values can be a List or a plain value a plain value can be a BigInteger / BigDecimal, a String, a Boolean or null
      void serialize(Parameterizable p, Writer w)
      Build syntax for a certain Parameterizable

      • parseParameterizable

        public Parameterizable parseParameterizable()
         syntax looks like this: {'P':[{'a':[1,2]},{'b':3}]}, P is the Parameterizable, a and b are parameters

 first and only entry in the Map is the name of the Parameterizable class and its parameters in a List
 each entry in the parameter List contains the parameter key and its value(s) in a Map
 parameter values can be a List or a plain value
 a plain value can be a BigInteger / BigDecimal, a String, a Boolean or null
        Returns:
